body:
Hi all, I'm watching the rails repository just in the last few days so if I write something wrong excuse me :).

Said this, I've seen the code and I've a couple of doubts. First of all, what the method should return when the min parameter is greater than max? This condition is not checked, for example if I call ```5.limit(10, 1)``` what I should get? 5 or 10 as the current implementation do? Probably it would be a good thing to raise an ```ArgumentError``` exception if the min parameter is greater than max.

Another doubt is about the use of 2 arguments insteat of a single Range object: I think who will use this method could want to use a range instead.

Speaking of who will use this method, I guess the name of the method could be better, ```limit``` doesn't explain well what it does, what about something like `constrain_in_range`, `limit_in_range` or at least `limit_in`? So you could call it like this ```vote.constrain_in_range(18, 30)```. Still I'm not sure about the real-life benefits of this addition.
